title: Behavior Factions
body: I been on this Board for a while and I do like to have talks with everyone I can. I have noticed there are a lot of factions. No one can seem to agree and most all the threads have thumbs downs. I don't know yet how to categorize them yet, but what do you guys think?

replies.body:
* I don't understand why I can't be the worst version of myself.
* I'm going to [sea lion](https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/873/260/a5b.png) my way through life.
* It doesn't affect me, so I don't think it's a problem.
* I'm an edgelord. No, really.
* The Boards are supposed to be my own private clubhouse.
* I don't understand Freedom of Speech or the First Amendment, but I'm still going to talk about them.
* I just want to play the fucking game. What is wrong with you people?
* I think poor play should be considered feeding.
* [FILL IN THE BLANK] is broken/OP!!!!!!!1111oneoneone
* I want to be able to call people stupid. That's my thing.
* I said really offensive things. Why is Rito mad?

I could go on...

Oh no, go on. I am listing. {{sticker:sg-poppy}}
The barbarian,  the paladin, some dude whos name skips my mind and lord DGAF is fine.
I have never looked at usernames myself. Too much time on 4chan I guess where everyone is anon

The Adventurer? I'll bet many of us have the adventurer as a secondary spirit.

Nope, the scarred veteran.

They who want to...

1. see people be punished, to find vindication through the rules. The most common sort here, because they have incentive to keep coming back.
2. champion the rules, to help others understand. Unlike 1, they do not glorify punishments and promote reformation. 
3. criticize the system, to highlight it's shortcomings. Some seek vindication from the rules, others to help the system's victims.
4. The "I got punished and I don't like it" crowd, the most common OP writers here.
5. The much less common "I got punished, and I want to understand" folks.

Many of the thumbs down come from the dominant 1 crowd. Many of their comments would be against the rules and it behooves them to hold their tongue. 

Sadly, there are few here interested in actually discussing behavior in an academic manner. I'm a type 3, like you!

Edit: Wait, were you talking about OP types?
No, OP types are almost always 4. I think you have a pretty good model for what I was referring to though.

I suppose type 5 is uncommon enough to be left out, and there are other less common sorts that don't fit in those 4 types. Like those just looking for examples of stupid and couldn't care less about people getting punished.
